text: #ChatSTC A10: Passwords remain your first line of defense
column4: and the best way to stay safe is to use a different password.

text: #ChatSTC A9a: Here are some tips for approaching the tech talk at home: https://t.co/1YIjPoUvSQ
#ChatSTC A8: Use strong unique passwords. Share those passwords with them through a password manager if needed.
#ChatSTC A8: Understand if the device is connected to 3rd parties and if strangers have the ability to contact your kids through the device.
#ChatSTC A7: Consider which security features are built-in and which private info is shared with the vendor and/or other 3rd parties.
#ChatSTC A6: Ask yourself: what do you know about this vendor? Have you shopped with them before? What personal info are they asking for?
#ChatSTC A4: It‚Äôs common sense
column4: but don‚Äôt accept personal checks if you‚Äôre selling personal goods for extra money this holiday season!

text: #ChatSTC A5: If you click on a deal
column4: is it the same item you were promised? Be prepared to walk away if uncomfortable at any point.

text: #ChatSTC A4: Credit cards often have better fraud protection than debit cards or local banking cards. Know ahead of time your protection.
#ChatSTC A3: Who made the app? Does it have reviews? What does the app request access to on your device? If it‚Äôs too much
column4: pass.

text: #ChatSTC A2: Share as little as you can ‚Äì don‚Äôt volunteer more infomation than a website or vendor is asking for.
